article.headline: Hawkins scores career-high 36 points for Temple
article.linkText: Hawkins enjoys career night as Owls defeat BC
article.story:
PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- David Hawkins scored 21 of his career-high
36 points in the second half to lead Temple past Boston College
75-62 in a first-round Owens Corning NIT game Friday night.

	   The Owls (17-15) will play Atlantic 10 foe Rhode Island in the
second round Tuesday.

	   Boston College (19-12) rallied from a 12-point first-half
deficit to go ahead by six on three occasions after the break. The
Eagles led 49-43 when Maurice Collins hit two free throws. Hawkins'
three-point play and a drive by Collins put the Owls ahead 49-48
with 12:17 left.

	   The Eagles trailed 59-55 with less than four minutes remaining
when Collins broke up a two-on-one break. Collins passed to
Hawkins, who laid the ball in, was fouled and made the free throw
to give Temple a 62-57 lead. The Owls salted the game away from the
free-throw line down the stretch.

	   Collins scored 17 points and Brian Polk added 12 for Temple.

	   Freshman Craig Smith led Boston College with 24 points. Big East
Player of the Year Troy Bell scored 15 on 5-of-19 shooting.
